glsa.title: WebSVN: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in WebSVN allow for file overwrite and information disclosure.

background.p: WebSVN is a web-based browsing tool for Subversion repositories written in PHP.

ul.li: James Bercegay of GulfTech Security reported a Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the getParameterisedSelfUrl() function in index.php (CVE-2008-5918) and a directory traversal vulnerability in rss.php when magic_quotes_gpc is disabled (CVE-2008-5919).
Bas van Schaik reported that listing.php does not properly enforce access restrictions when using an SVN authz file to authenticate users (CVE-2009-0240).

impact.p: A remote attacker can exploit these vulnerabilities to overwrite arbitrary files, to read changelogs or diffs for restricted projects and to hijack a user's session.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
